review_blob:
Wow!! Not sure why, but wow. I wasn't expecting this beer to taste this good. My first quaff was followed what felt like 4-5 successive taste receptors/experiences going off. It was delightful. The sour & malt are each distinct & neither would necessarily please me, yet they consummate forming one blissful union. It's big bold flavour leaves the palate clean due to the hops. This beer is doing it for me. Wow.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nicely balanced with hops & malt. This is an easy drinking beer. A good example of a brown ale imo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish hue in the glass. Tinge of pink in the foam. Has a natural fruity aroma. Tastes sour then tart, just like a cranberry should. It's right for the Christmas season.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A decent pils. Nothing memorable. Just marketing. I love the glassware with the gift pack. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Central City The Hobbit: Gollum Precious Pils

review_blob:
I found the Ranger to be well-balanced. Crisp & refreshing. Just the right amount of bitter grapefruit for my taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly dry hops. Grapefruit on the nose & palate. Light to medium bitter. I liked the balance. This is what clean & crisp is all about.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden look. Light yeast & light bitterness. It's an easy drinking beer. Some sweetness to it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black in the glass. Espresso crema head... Or I want it to be:) it's exciting. Flavours of espresso & rye. Cereal grain on the nose. It's a terrific lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I like it. It's light & refreshing. Now my favs are typically strong Belgian ales. I love Hefeweizen's too & this is much lighter. This beer is what Molson's Old Style Pilsner should be. You put this beer in that can & you've got a bonafide heavyweight. You'd have "pretty boy" Floyd Mayweather in a can. An undefeated champ, taking on all comers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: R & B Sun God Wheat Ale

review_blob: Its smooth, yet bubbly, like my personality. Ive been craving pils lately. This one has a bit more flavour than most. Czech beer for the masses. Some light skunky bitterness. The green bottles are killing me. While do they do that? Maybe the beer doesnt really taste much better in good condition? Best experience was in a plastic cup with a sausage from a street vendor in Prague. Stella, Heineken, Urquell - whats the difference really?

Im not sure why it needs mangos. For me it doesnt impart anything fruitier than might otherwise from a wheat ale. Its a good wheat ale. Im not opposed to mangos, I dont necessarily need exotic fruit in my beer. Id be interested to see what it tastes like without the fruit mash. Ill order it again, heck Ill probably by a 6 pack. Its a good summer beer.
beer_name: Old Yale Co Moon Dance Mango Wheat

review_blob: Decent beer. Unfiltered. More malt than hops though both came through individually. Malt first then hops. Lively carbonation. Though, not memorable. Likely wont go out of my way to buy a bottle... well arent I a curmudgeon.
beer_name: Vancouver Island / Steel & Oak United Front Unfiltered Braun Beer

beer_brewer_name: Turning Point Brewery/Stanley Park Brewing (Labatt - ABInBev)
review_blob:
Drank it from the can. Light on flavour. More carbonation than hell's gate pale ale. Your basic corn beer. Nothing to write home about & if you did, mom would be crying her eyes out that her baby is drinking this swill. The pale ale is marginally better if only for more metallic flavour. On the plus side it's cheaper than most & no preservatives. Brewed on Annacis Island in Delta BC. That brewery brews for several different brands. This isn't hell but you can see it from here.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dense beige head. Caramel, raisins, & the sweetness of other dried fruits. For me it's more of a digestif. I wasn't in the mood for it, but it was what I had on hand on a 30 degree Celsius day. The 10.5% can hit pretty quickly in these conditions. Alcohol is high to balance the rich complexity of this beer. It's big, malty, & sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyed in glass poured from a 650ml bottle. Hint of spice, more akin to smoked paprika... or chipotle:) Some hops in there. Its a drinkable ale. Goes well with bbq. Got better halfway through the glass... the 2nd. Something fun & different. It works. My 100th rating. Didnt think it would take me this long. I like the journal aspect of ratebeer. Great work! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very enjoyable from a growler. A touch of sour, plenty of blueberries on the nose. A summer bbq bevy. Fruit is not artificial tasting. I'd definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A pleasant offering from Molson's. It's distinct from other Rickard's products. I'd drink it again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to buy a case.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It's a light beer, refreshing on a hot summer day. Easy to drink. Mix it with Clamato juice?? It's not as bad as most have rated it. It actually has some flavour over it's siblings. Comment of previous rating: it's Carona with lime flavour. But better taste imo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a pretty decent Octoberfest. Smooth, easy drinking, and enjoyable. Goes well with turkey dinner. Seemed reasonably well balanced. So nice to enjoy beer with the seasons.

beer_brewer_name: Turning Point Brewery/Stanley Park Brewing (Labatt - ABInBev)
review_blob: Ive never bought this because its in the s--t section of the beer store. Just sitting there on the concrete floor... 24s of it stacked high. Theres lots to be judgemental about. Until I tried one. My expectations were very low. I knew Id hate it... but then... the first swig danced over my palate and down my gullet. Reminded me of the Banquet Beer. The same metallic taste is there. And I like it. Plus its cheap. Really cheap. In Canada Coors Original is stupid expensive. This is cheap and bubbly and metallic. Just like a nice Banquet Beer.
A decent pils. Seemed to go well with the pizza we had. Nothing memorable. I guess its no Old Style Pils from Sasky. Wheres the rabbit?
Its easy an easy drinking brown ale. Something accessible for the uninitiated. Latest tasting was over ribs and a number of different brews.
The lighter side of scotch ales. For me not the best that comes out of Parallel 49. Still proud to have this brewery in Vancouver.

Had several buddies over for beer and ribs. Sampled a number of brews throughout the evening. This immediately stood out, even after my palate was fatigued with rich food and beer. Outstanding floral character. To a man, from the neophyte beer drinker to more discerning palate, they enjoyed this beer at my table.

Citrus and sweet. Hazy/unfiltered in the glass. Central City has got something genuine here with their take on the Tripel. I suppose the label will attract the nerd who might not otherwise pick up a bottle from Central City Brewing. Wait... I bought one.
beer_name: Central City The Hobbit: Bolg Belgian Style Tripel

review_blob:
Not a balanced beer. Too thin on the finish. It's drinkable, nothing outstanding. It's no Schneider Weiss hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yeast flavour, a touch of malt. It's bananas! A hint of cloves delicately dances on my palate. The translucent yellow liquid is shrouded in white velvet foam. Unfiltered particles swim lazily through the murky yellow elixir. Ok this is getting weird...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quite enjoyable. A bottle from a friend. 650ml bottle. I wish I could say more but it might have been the 3rd or 4th one we tested. My palate was fatigued... yes that's it, palate fatigue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review for what is likely my favourite beer. It's full flavoured. The whole palate experiences something. It has depth. Terrific balance. Enjoyed best out of the Rochefort chalice. For me Trappist beer is magical. Rochefort 10 is great on its own or with a meal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle. Rich, dark, sweet, higher viscosity. A bit of spice. Feel like I need more time with it. Pretty good beer for the holidays.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The grapefruit came through strongest for me. Not overly bitter. Citrus fruit. Nice session ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I think this particular beer would receive higher scores from the community if it had been put out by some micro. My snobbery caused me to rate it lower, then I changed my score. I enjoyed it. It's a nice summer treat on a hot day. It's very drinkable & a great entry point for folks used to drinking "swill" lite. A previous poster makes this point very well. 

Wow, unfiltered beer! Looks great. At the end of the day a Hoegaarden isote satisfying, but a good effort for what It is & what it tries to do.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Coriander, yeast, & citrus aromas. Has a long finish that ends in with a kick. It was a pleasant surprise. I loved the spice/chilli heat. I found it quite enjoyable and Id drink it again. Worth a go if only for something youve never experienced before.
beer_name: Steamworks / New Belgium Rollin Golden Belgian Ale

review_blob: Not overly memorable. Though enjoyable enough. Would I got out of my way to buy it? I suppose not. Am I glad I did? Okay, I didnt. A friend did and generously offered to share. Nothing exceptional, nothing offensive. Good photo here.

Absolutely no head. Very pale yellow. Served ice cold. Literally ice cold. Not a bad thing for this kind of beer. A hint of wheat/malt comes through. Not much to it. Glad I tried a local beer here in Santa Cruz, Bolivia.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It's smooth in the same way that flat San Pellegrino water is smooth. Not as much metallic flavour as the Banquet beer, but close. An oxymoron at 6%. It's drinkable enough. Just not memorable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured out of a bottle. Had it with a 10oz ribeye. Lots of big flavours. A smooth drinking dark brew. A great experience. The deScription on the bottle says it all.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown-amber. Big head fully diminishes. Delicate carbonation. Intricate lacing. Malty aroma. Very smooth mouthfeel. Refreshing at room temp. Delightful silage aftertaste. Earthy. Easy drinking. I wasn't sure what to expect. Serendipitous experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Im somewhat surprised I rated this so high, but I like everything about this beer. I love coffee. I love beer. I love chocolate. I love the aroma of coffee and beer together. It looks great. The head is a rich caramel-brown and it lasts. Picked it up at the brewery in Tofino after sampling. Loved the experience. Its a rich full flavoured offering. Im a fan and will be drinking it again soon.

Purchased from the brewery in Tofino. Looks great - copper orange. Smooth hops flavour if that makes sense. Doesn't have the bitter bite to it. Citrus notes on the nose. A good IPA worth trying.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I don't know what I'm tasting but at least it's something & I like it. It's got a tad more flavour than it's competitors. I like it better than anything else molson & coors light for sure. This banquet beer is better than Kokanee or Keith's. The story has some cred too. CDN taxes make this double what it cost in US. I got a free glass with a 12 pack. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014

Hazy and copper. True, smells of sweet toffee. Flavour is on the sweeter side. It is smooth, small bubbles just before it finishes. As the liquid warmed in my goblet, the taste got less desirable. Not bad mind you, just the malt came forward. Not as balanced as others have suggested. Am I smelling a hint of banana? I like they put the ingredients on the label. This should be legally mandatory.
beer_name: Phillips Slipstream Cream Ale (aka Draught Dodger 2008)

review_blob: Darker than I expected, so it was a pleasant surprise. I prefer darker to lighter. I dont have a problem with this as a session beer. Fully diminishing head, light maltiness, and with hints of caramel. Not memorable but not bad. Ill drink it again.

Tried it first onsite at the brewery in a tasting glass. Once home I tried in a 35cl glass and what a difference. Far better experience. This blonde is full of flavour. The malt is there. Yes the carbonation is light, but its a blonde. I absolutely love that their beer is unfiltered. IMO it makes the appearance richer and more appealing. Its quite drinkable, goes down easy.

75cl bottle. Lively carbonation. Quite effervescent. It's a yeasty, wheaty, sweety. The flavour was good, though I found the alcohol a bit strong. Perhaps could be balanced better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
